DOC.brief_summary: A Study evaluate utility ProLung Test adjunct CT scan diagnosis lung cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluate Utility ProLung Test Adjunctive CT Scan Diagnosis Lung Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: This Study assess stability ProLung Test classification algorithm use adjunct CT scan . This Study assess whether potential safety concern ProLung Test use evaluate patient positive CT scan lung cancer .
DOC.criteria: Subject male female , age 18 . If female , subject nonchildbearing potential meaning permanently sterile , one year postmenopausal ; pregnant confirm negative urine pregnancy test use adequate birth control time screen . Subject present one follow clinical symptom suspicious radiological finding ( ) : Persistent cough Hoarseness Shortness breath Sputum streak blood Fatigue Unexplained recent weight loss Recurrent pneumonia bronchitis Chest pain Abnormal chest radiograph Subject undergone CT scan lung within 44 day measurement indicate one noncalcified nodule ( NCN ) lung mass suspicious lung cancer . Subject capable understanding agree fulfill requirement protocol . Subject sign IRB/IEC approve informed consent form . â€¢ Subjects meet one follow criterion may enrol Study : Subject pacemaker implant electronic device . Subject diagnose malignancy within past 5 ( five ) year except nonmelanoma skin cancer . Subject significant systemic disease include uncontrolled diabetes , severe heart failure , uncontrolled hypertension , myocardial infarction and/or autoimmune condition within prior 3 ( three ) month . Subject take systemic corticosteroid medication ( except inhale ) within 14 day prior measurement session . Subject invasive medical procedure involve thoracic cavity within 30 day prior measurement session . Subject currently abuse alcohol drug . Subject present anomalous physical anatomical condition precludes measurement . Subject undergone unusually strenuous exercise within 24 hour prior measurement session . Subject , Principal Investigator 's opinion , medical condition circumstance would prevent completion Study interfere analysis Study result . Subjects undergone radiation chemotherapy treatment within past 30 day . Subject receive therapy document suspected chest infection . Pregnant lactating female .
